reviews.text: We have just had a four day break at Thurlestone - our aim had been to find a high quality seaside hotel with excellent food, pool and good childrens facilities. Thurlestone looks excellent from its website but in reality is not as good as it should or could be. It does not seem to know what it wants to be or the clientelle it is aiming for.
reviews.title: Overpriced for the quality and experience !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You approach it from the back which is not a pretty site, the front is thankfully much better and gives an indication of how it has been enlarged over the years.
reviews.title: Dreadful - see photos

likes.disliked: — The mouldy walls and ceiling, the thin walls, facilities all out of order

reviews.text: The decor is tired and very traditional - the hotel has been run by the same fa,ily for over a hundered years and they are clearly very proud of their heritage and achievements - from the detailed history book avialble in the room it is clear that they have faced difficlut times in the past and made bold and successful decisions - we felt it is time for some more of these ! Updated decor would be a great start - especially in the public rooms but the bedrooms would defintely benefit too - I beleive they have started on some but our suite had not been done yet.
reviews.title: A hotel in a fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many guests are clearly returning year after year and they receive a noticeably warmer welcomes then new visitors like us did. We felt perhaps they were blind to the actual quality on offer ?
reviews.title: Expensive for the quality

reviews.text: The outdoor pool is excellent though, the indoor one needs refreashing. The restaurant has fine views but again needs new decor. The food was absolutely excellent throughout and a credit to them which really made our break in light of the other disappointments. The restaurant staff could have been better - managers good but waiting staff a little abrubt and lacking in knowkedge of the dishes on offer.
reviews.title: Excellent location and facilities

reviews.text: There were no real suprises here as the reports on tripadvisor proved very accurate, we took a village view family suite which was nice & clean with an extra toilet for the children(plentiful TV channels). The staff were friendly, helpful and the food was all of a high standard. The facilities were plentiful & could probably still occupy you on a rainy day. The par 3 golf course is suitable for most holiday players & the thurlestone course a short walk away next to the beach, the tennis was quite popular but quite strangely the pools, table tennis,badmington, squash & even the golf course were mostly unutilized although this may be because we visited the week before the regular school holidays.
reviews.title: nice place to stay

reviews.text: To give some balance the negatives were the price,the dinner arrangements of encouraging adults only with a jacket for gentlemen & the danny the dolphine club was pathetic! We take our holidays to relax & spend time with our young children so having dinner apart & wearing a jacket is not really conducive to this. Lastly the clientele are mostly aspirational middle class & propriety rather than letting your hair down was the general tone so this may not suit everone, but this was probally why the pool was devoid of adults & tennis was the most popular sport.
reviews.title: Great family hotel - but at a price

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at THurlestone for a short holiday with our baby & toddler. The kids facilities at the hotel are superb - tolerant & friendly staff who go out of their way to help out at mealtimes including the early supper, great entertainment (crafts sessions, magician show, tea party etc) and of course the pools and beach. We stayed in a family suite which was good and roomy enough for two travel cots to go into the living area. The baby listening service allowed us to go to the neighbouring pub for dinner (we didn't eat in the main restaurant, didn't want a formal affair with gents in jackets, ladies in evening dress etc) which was great - fish just hauled out of the water and live music.
reviews.title: 20 years of continued excellence!!

reviews.text: While the room was comfortable, it didn't exactly set my pulse racing on the design / luxury front - it clearly hadn't been decorated for a long time or with any great thought to style even then. The view over the carpark and recycling facility was pretty grim (staff cigarette break time was the most interesting thing to see) which given the whopping price (about £350 per night with the child fee included) could have been better.
reviews.title: spectacular location 5 star food great amenities delightful staff

reviews.text: All round it seems well suited for children or the large number of retired golfers who were also staying - there is more than a hint of the 1970s about the place (the bar menu liqueur list is hilarious, quite the widest selection of creme de menthes I've seen).
reviews.title: Loved it, can't reccommend highly enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Off the beaten track it is not easily found and on arriving we thought that from the outside this hotel doesn't really fit in with the surroundings. It should be 100 years old. It is situated just off the Southwest coastal path and therefore ideally situated for walking. We stayed for three nights for the special occasion of my wifes 50th birthday. The hotel didn't dissapoint, the room was very clean and recently refurbished, the food and service in the restaurant was second to none. It is a place for calm and quiet as the majority of people were aged between 65-80yrs. We took advantage of the sports facilities which were all available and in good condition probably due to the age of the guests. Whilst we were treated with respect I had hoped for a little more due to the occasion. Perhaps I was expecting too much. Would we return, yes we would............8/10
reviews.title: For that special occasion

likes.disliked: — Dogs being allowed in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were originally booked in to stay for two nights - but enjoyed it so much we stayed an extra night. We were looking for a short break which included a reasonable amount of exercise so The Thurlstone was ideal. The biggest selling points for us were the squash courts, badminton court, golf course, table tennis, snooker table, swimming pool - all of which were in extremely good order and it felt more like a country club than a hotel. The location was also ideal as it had easy walking access to cliff walks and coves. The staff were very friendly, the room was very comfortable (if a little dated) and the food excellent. The only downsides were the price (rather high though understandable considering the amenities) and the bizarre dresscode in the restaurant - jacket required, even if worn over a T-shirt and jeans.
reviews.title: More like a country club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though all-in-all an enjoyable stay and we hope to return with friends to spend more time enjoying the golf and squash.
reviews.title: Pure Indulgence

likes.disliked: — I dont like the curtains in the lounge!

reviews.title: Over-proced, over-rated
reviews.text: My Husband and I have been visiting the Thurlestone Hotel for 7 years now. It never fails to disappoint and quite frankly I never want to come home. Most would probably associate the hotel with older guests but we are both in our early 30s and find it the only place where we can both fully relax and feel totally pampered. My Husband comments it’s the only place he can have an afternoon nap.

The newly refurbished Premier rooms are a beautiful mix of modern and traditional country décor, just what you expect from a private 4* Hotel. The beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in and I prefer them to home! Also for summer visitors the balconies are glass so as not to interrupt the view which evens manages to be inspiring in the worst weather.
reviews.title: fantastic stay

likes.liked: — spacious rooms, good decor, very comfortable beds

reviews.text: I am basing this review on a one-night stay, of which only a few hours was spent in the hotel (apart from sleeping, of course) so I appreciate my experience is limited. Nonetheless, these were my impressions.
reviews.title: Pricey but nice.

likes.liked: — Generally high standards, good breakfast, great indoor pool.
likes.disliked: — Room service - poor quality, seriously overpriced.

reviews.text: Due to a family bereavement, we had a one night stay at The Thurlestone Hotel. I doubt I could afford to stay here for a whole week in summer as it is expensive but I chose it for this trip because it has a swimming pool and was close to where we needed to go. The pool was important because we made a 600 mile round trip in 24 hours and I wanted my son and daughter to be able to have a swim after being cooped up in the car for so long.
reviews.title: Still excellent

reviews.text: The family room was spacious and all the usual goodies were provided...nice toiletries, robes (although they are a bit stingy with the tea/coffee etc). There is room service although outside of restaurant hours this is just sandwiches and cream teas. While the kids were in the pool, I ordered sandwiches.....I was seriously unimpressed with the quantity and quality for £6-£8 a throw! On returning from the pool, my 11 year old said, "Why is my sandwich the size of a baby's?" However, the report from the pool was better, with both the 11 and 17 yr old giving it the thumbs up and my son also liked the games room.
reviews.title: Great mid week break

likes.disliked: — The one individual who wasn't good on customer care!

reviews.text: The staff were all very polite, friendly and helpful. Breakfast was plentiful and very good. Our visit wasn't for pleasure, unfortunately, but even though the hotel was almost full I found it extremely quiet and sedate which, under different circumstances, would not have suited me. It also made me question why the fairly ample car park was overflowing when we returned that night.
reviews.title: Over-priced

likes.disliked: — Noise, heat and overall poor value for money

reviews.text: They do cater very well for children of all ages and apparently in summer this is a big draw. There is an outdoor pool as well, a salon/spa, restaurant, special early supper for kids (optional) and child minding. All rooms are non-smoking. Check in is at 3, check out at 11. Bookings can be made via their website but not for family rooms, so I had to call for my reservation. The person I dealt with was very helpful and negotiated a little, for which I was very grateful. Overall, it's a lovely hotel. Room service falls way short of value for money, even for a classy hotel, but that's my only gripe.
reviews.title: A Legendary British Hotel in a Magical Location

likes.disliked: — A little on the small side
